Name: DGS CORPUS
Description: The DGS Corpus is a collection of German Sign Language (DGS) data from 330 signers from Germany. The 15-year long-term project is based at the Institute of German Sign Language and Communication of the Deaf at the Universit√§t Hamburg and started in 2009. It is led by Thomas Hanke and Annika Herrmann. The DGS Corpus is used to build the DGS-German dictionary DW-DGS
